result.execSummary:
The defendant Claudio Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done, pay surcharge, pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 9-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.
Court advises defendant may not possess a firearm, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Claudio Garcia
Current: 6329 South 35th Street, Last Reported Address, Milwaukee, WI   (Effective: 04-04-2014)
Prior: Area Of 14th And Lincoln, Last Reported Address, Milwaukee, WI
Defendant informs the court that current address has been changed FROM:  Area of 14th and Lincoln./ds

Sentencing proceeds.    Statements by counsel, Charles A.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 6 days at the House of Correction with 6 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 9-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Claudio Garcia in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Paul L. Tiffin for Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Claudio Garcia in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant would like a court trial.  Upon questioning, Court finds the defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to a jury trial.  Court trial scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Claudio Garcia not in court.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case called at 8:51 a.m.  No appearance by defense attorney.  Court will be starting a lengthy motion and releases the district attorney to go to other Courts.

Defendant Claudio Garcia in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Joshua M. Mathy on behalf of Chris Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case set for scheduling conference.  ADA Liegel is in charging and not able to appear.  ADA Mathy or ADA Liegel will provided defense with an offer at the next court.  Parties advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter is reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room 506 safety building.   Case is adjourned to Br 44.  Status conference scheduled for 08-07-2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Claudio Garcia in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Claudio Garcia in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Claudio Garcia in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. jg
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Preliminary Hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 a.m.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
